intro: Jupunba cochleata var. moniliformis, commonly known as the spiral-shaped milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves and its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Asclepiadaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions with cool, temperate climates. This variant is notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
